Detailed Description

class Charger Charger is the APOXI device abstraction interface for charger hardware driver.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Charger::ChargerMsgType
 

ChargerMsgType

Enumerator:
ChargerRemoved 
ChargeBattery  former BatteryChargerRemovedMsg
ChargingPaused  former BatteryChargingMsg
ChargingResumed  former ChargingPausedMsg
LowBattery  former ChargingResumedMsg
BatteryIdError  former BatteryLowMsg
BatteryEmpty  former BatteryIdErrorMsg
ChargeEndChargerIsDisconnected  former BatteryEmptyMsg
ChargeEndBatteryIsFull  former BatteryStopChargingMsg reason = ChargeEndBatteryFull

enum Charger::ChargerStatus
 

ChargerStatus

Enumerator:
Disabled 
WaitingForConnection  charger has not been initialized
ConnectedAndCharging  the charger is not connected
ConnectedAndTemperatureProtection  the charger is connected and charging is active
ConnectedAndBatteryFull  the charger is connected and charging is inactive due to temperature protection
DisconnectedAndBatteryFull  the charger is connected and charging is inactive due to battery full
DisconnectedAndBatteryNotFull  the battery is full and the charger has recently been removed - waiting to stop
ChargerDisabledBatteryIdError  the battery is not full and the charger has recently been removed - waiting to stop
ChargerDisabledVoltageError  charger driver is disabled due to low voltage

UINT8 Charger::GetCapacityStatus (   )  [static]
 

returns how much capacity is left - expressed as percentage of full capacity. Value range: [0..100]

const WCHAR * Charger::GetName (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns the name of a device. The name must not be unique and should just give a short description of the device.

Implements AbstractDevice.
